places.title: Seattle Public Library
places.description: The architecture is pretty neat. Unfortunately, during my most recent visit (Jan 2022), most floors were closed so you can't see much of it.

places.title: Hannyatou
places.description: Cozy bar. We stopped by here while waiting for a table at Kamonegi next door. I like that they have a fridge for retail so you can get sake to go.

places.title: Kamonegi
places.description: Specializes in tempura and soba. The tempura and starting sides are delicious. I liked the tsukemono and the ankimo. I had high hopes for the soba, but I think the noodles aren't quite the right consistency - too chewy and thick.

places.title: Nana's Green Tea
places.description: Probably the highlight of the trip. Really tasty snacks and light lunch. The katsu sando is better than the one at [Hi Collar](../nyc/). The sundae is on par with the one from [Cha-an](../nyc/). Really great. Worth a visit.

places.title: REI Flagship
places.description: Biggest REI I've been to. There's a climbing wall, mini-bike trail, and waterfall on site.

places.title: Storyville Coffee
places.description:
Really cute spot. The one in Pike Place overlooks the water. Coffee is not terrible, but not amazing, especially for the high prices.

The cinnamon roll is worth a try but gave me a stomachache afterwards.
